main event: Three civilian observers in Stoughton, Wisconsin reported seeing a large, oval-shaped object with a light yellow to bright white glow on March 2, 1967.
interesting points: The object was described as larger than a star, ranging from 15-25 feet in length by different observers.
The object hovered over the ground for about 5 minutes before moving away towards the west-southwest.
One observer tried to drive towards the object, but it disappeared by the time they got there.
The weather was reported as scattered and clear, with wind speeds up to 110 mph at higher altitudes.
Several other observers reportedly called the local police about the same sighting.
sighted object: large, oval-shaped object with a light yellow to bright white glow
